description: Sent whenever a user logs in.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EATON-EPDU-MIB::notifyUserLogin EATON-EPDU-MIB::userName s EXAMPLE EATON-EPDU-MIB::commInterface i 0

description: Username used to log into the PDU.

description: Communications interface used to log into the PDU.
variables.name: EATON-EPDU-MIB::commInterface

description: Sent whenever a user logs out.

variables.name: EATON-EPDU-MIB::userName

description: Communications interface used to log into the PDU.

description: Sent when someone attempts to log in and fails. On some models, may be
sent after three failed login attempts.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EATON-EPDU-MIB::notifyFailedLogin EATON-EPDU-MIB::userName s EXAMPLE EATON-EPDU-MIB::commInterface i 0

description: Username used to log into the PDU.
variables.name: EATON-EPDU-MIB::userName

description: Communications interface used to log into the PDU.

description: Sent whenever an ePDU finishes booting up (hard or soft reboot).
For units that support 'strapping' functionality, this will be a unique
value for each unit. If units do not support 'strapping', this will
always be '0'.
variables.name: EATON-EPDU-MIB::strappingIndex

description: Sent whenever an input voltage threshold status changes.

Summary.eval: ($v5==0) ? 'Voltage in normal range on input $v1' : (($v5==1 || $v5==2) ? 'Low voltage on input $v1' : 'High voltage on input $v1')

tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD EATON-EPDU-MIB::notifyInputVoltageThStatus EATON-EPDU-MIB::strappingIndex i 0 EATON-EPDU-MIB::inputIndex i 1 EATON-EPDU-MIB::inputVoltageIndex i 1 EATON-EPDU-MIB::inputVoltage i 9999 EATON-EPDU-MIB::inputVoltageThStatus i 0

$SNMPTRAPCMD EATON-EPDU-MIB::notifyInputVoltageThStatus EATON-EPDU-MIB::strappingIndex i 0 EATON-EPDU-MIB::inputIndex i 1 EATON-EPDU-MIB::inputVoltageIndex i 1 EATON-EPDU-MIB::inputVoltage i 9999 EATON-EPDU-MIB::inputVoltageThStatus i 2

description: For units that support 'strapping' functionality, this will be a unique
value for each unit. If units do not support 'strapping', this will
always be '0'.
variables.name: EATON-EPDU-MIB::strappingIndex

description: A unique value for each input. Its value ranges from 1 to inputCount.
variables.name: EATON-EPDU-MIB::inputIndex

description: A unique value for each input voltage measurement. Its value ranges
from 1 to inputVoltageCount.
variables.name: EATON-EPDU-MIB::inputVoltageIndex

description: An input voltage measurement value. Units are millivolts.
variables.name: EATON-EPDU-MIB::inputVoltage

description: Status of the measured input voltage relative to the configured thresholds.
variables.name: EATON-EPDU-MIB::inputVoltageThStatus

description: Sent whenever an input current threshold status changes.

Summary.eval: ($v5==0) ? 'Current in normal range on input $v1' : (($v5==1 || $v5==2) ? 'Low current on input $v1' : 'High current on input $v1')

tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD EATON-EPDU-MIB::notifyInputCurrentThStatus EATON-EPDU-MIB::strappingIndex i 0 EATON-EPDU-MIB::inputIndex i 1 EATON-EPDU-MIB::inputCurrentIndex i 1 EATON-EPDU-MIB::inputCurrent i 9999 EATON-EPDU-MIB::inputCurrentThStatus i 0

from 1 to inputCurrentCount.

description: Status of the measured input current relative to the configured thresholds.

description: Sent whenever the input frequency status changes.

tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD EATON-EPDU-MIB::notifyInputFrequencyStatus EATON-EPDU-MIB::strappingIndex i 0 EATON-EPDU-MIB::inputIndex i 1 EATON-EPDU-MIB::inputFrequency i 9999 EATON-EPDU-MIB::inputFrequencyStatus i 0

value for each unit. If units do not support 'strapping', this will

description: A unique value for each input. Its value ranges from 1 to inputCount.
variables.name: EATON-EPDU-MIB::inputIndex

description: Units are 0.1 Hz; divide by ten to get Hz.
variables.name: EATON-EPDU-MIB::inputFrequency

description: Status of the measured input frequency relative to the nominal frequency and the admitted tolerance.

description: Sent whenever a group voltage threshold status changes.

Summary.eval: ($v4==0) ? 'Group $v2 voltage is normal' : (($v4==1 || $v4==2) ? 'Group $v2 voltage is low' : 'Group $v2 voltage is high')

breaker is on or off.

value for each unit. If units do not support 'strapping', this will
always be '0'.

ranges from 1 to temperatureCount.

description: Units are in tenths of a degree according to the scale specified by
temperatureScale (either Fahrenheit or Celsius). Divide by ten to get
degrees.

description: Status of the measured temperature relative to the configured
thresholds.

description: Sent whenever the PDU communication status changes.

Summary.eval: ($v2==0) ? 'Internal communication is in good state' : 'Internal communication lost'

$SNMPTRAPCMD EATON-EPDU-MIB::notifyCommunicationStatus EATON-EPDU-MIB::strappingIndex i 0 EATON-EPDU-MIB::communicationStatus i 1

value for each unit. If units do not support 'strapping', this will
always be '0'.

description: Status of the internal communication with the PDU.
variables.name: EATON-EPDU-MIB::communicationStatus

description: Sent whenever the PDU internal status changes.

Summary.eval: ($v2==0) ? 'PDU internal state is good' : 'PDU has an internal failure'

value for each unit. If units do not support 'strapping', this will
always be '0'.

description: Sent whenever the trap test feature is used by the communication card.
Sent whenever the strapping communication status changes.

Summary.eval: ($v2==0) ? 'Communication with strapping unit $v1 is in good state' : 'Communication with strapping unit $v1 lost'

value for each unit. If units do not support 'strapping', this will
always be '0'.
